IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
ATTACHMENTS:

     1)  MSP Death Investigation Report Form 89B
     2)  NCIC/Miles Printouts

COMPLAINANT:

     1)  Peter Wendyl Keifer  W/M 04/30/1947 (Parent of Victim)
          2300 Shades Ln
          Cumberland, MD 21502

VICTIM:

     1)  Manda Dyan Keifer  W/F 06/11/1983
          2300 Shades Ln
          Cumberland, MD 21502

SUSPECT:

    N/A

SCENE PROCESSING:

     I observed the victim bent over/laying on the floor of their bedroom with their left arm on the bed. The victim was positioned between their bed and a wall of the bedroom. The victim was wearing a tie-dye tank top style shirt and flower pattern sleep style shorts. I observed bright red blood coming from underneath the victim and traveling away from the victim along the wall next to them. Additionally, I observed several drug paraphernalia items around the victim and in the bedroom where the victim was located. 

     Upon moving the victim, the victim was found to have a laceration on their face/forehead. This laceration appeared to have been made by the victim striking something as they fell or when they became unresponsive. No signs of foul play or suicide were observed. After the victim was removed from the bedroom and upon further examination of the bedroom, several more drug paraphernalia items and unknown CDS observed in the bedroom. Due to the nature/dangers of the drug paraphernalia (needles/syringes/ext) and the nature of the CDS (Possible Heroin), no paraphernalia/CDS was removed from the victims bedroom. 

      I took photographs of the scene and victim. These photographs were uploaded to VeriPic. 

NEIGHBORHOOD CHECK:

     N/A

NARRATIVE:

     On 10/11/2023 at approximately 2059 hours, I was dispatched to 2300 Shades Lane, Cumberland, MD for a report of a death investigation. Upon my arrival, I spoke with Allegany County/Bedford Road VFD EMS personnel. I was advised that located the victim in an upstairs bedroom of the residence and upon their arrival, no life-saving measures were taken due to the condition of the victim. Bedford Road Fire Department Paramedic Collins pronounced the victim, Manda Keifer, deceased at 2100 hours. EMS stated that they have been to this residence on several occasions for overdose or other related calls for service for the victim, Manda Keifer. Additionally, EMS advised that because of the victims close proximity to the bedroom door/entrance, they did remove the door to the victims bedroom upon their arrival to have better access to the victim and room.

      I then conducted the above-mentioned scene processing. I then spoke with the complainant, Peter Keifer and Ruth Keifer. Peter Keifer advised that after not seeing or hearing from his daughter, Manda Keifer, for an extended period of time (evening of 10/10/23), he went to her bedroom. Peter Keifer advised that he then found Manda Keifer unresponsive on the floor of her bedroom and called 911. While speaking with Peter Keifer and Ruth Keifer, they advised that Manda Keifer has been known to use/abuse narcotics, to include Heroin, and has for the past 20 years. Peter/Ruth Keifer advised that Manda Keifer has overdosed in the residence and at other locations before. Peter/Ruth Keifer advised that Manda Keifer's children, Julie Starr Flanagan 12/22/03 and Maddox Mckee Keifer 11/09/07 and her brother, Brandon Clark Keifer 11/23/75, also live in the residence. 

     Due to the nature of the incident, Allegany County C3I was made aware of the investigation, Forensic Investigator, Pamela Burkett, was notified and responded to the scene. Additional scene processing and examination of the victim was completed by Forensic Investigator Pamela Burkett. Based on the examination of the scene and information provided by Peter/Ruth Keifer, the victim was transported by Heartfelt Mortuary Transport to the States Medical Examiner's Office for an autopsy. Peter/Ruth Keifer were advised to make contact the MSP Cumberland Barrack the following day in order to reach the Allegany County EMS hazmat team to safely remove the paraphernalia and CDS items from the victims bedroom.   

     I request this case be CLOSED and forwarded to Allegany County C3I for any follow-up investigation. All events occurred in Allegany County, Maryland. 

CASE CLOSED.
